intro: Monomeria gymnopus, commonly known as the hairy monomeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Monomeria gymnopus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert habitats.
